intro: Centratherum, commonly known as the everlasting or centaurea, is a genus of flowering plants in the family Asteraceae. These plants are characterized by their showy, composite flower heads that consist of both ray and disk florets. Centratherum species are typically herbaceous, with upright stems and narrow, linear leaves. They are native to various regions across Europe, Asia, and Africa. Many species are cultivated for their ornamental value in gardens and landscapes.
